leilakal wrote:

> Hello,
> 
> To test the following private method: 
> 
> private ArrayList quad(Node[] ns, int a, int b){...}
> 
> I am using junitx:
> 
> Node[] ns = {n1,n2,n3}
> Object[] args = {ns, new Integer(0), new Integer(5)};
> ArrayList mcss = 
>       (ArrayList) invokeWithKey(d,"Node[]_int_int",args );
> Which does not work since ns is not an object.  I tried
> Arrays.asList(ns) which doesn't work either.  Anyone has any idea
> how to pass an array of objects (and also an array of primitive
> types) to invokeWithKey?

Hm. That's strange, because I believe arrays are Objects in Java.

One thing: according to the documentation, "Node" needs to be the 
package qualified name of the class (like java.lang.String). Maybe 
that's part of the problem.

Can you try it with just invoke() instead, to see whether that works? If 
you need to, rename the method to something unique just until you get 
the test working.

Good luck.
